title: [api.data.gov] Leak Valid API With out Verification -

profile.name: TTS Bug Bounty
profile.about: The First Civilian Agency Public Bug Bounty Program

vulnerability_information:
Description 
Remote attackers are able to retrieve a valid working api key with random Generation Process without a secure parsing or secure channel , human verification ..etc . 
the current proccess for requesting any api key is with signup form , and message with api delivered privately to user , developer ..etc 
so in this vulnerability any user can send alot of requests for any  email with valid leaked api key . 

Vulnerable module 
=================
[+] api-umbrella/v1/users.json 

Vulnerable parameter 
=====================
[+] options%5Bverify_email%5D


Proof of concept 
=============================
1. goes to signup form https://api.data.gov/signup/
2. intercept the post data 
3. change parameter value s%5Bverify_email%5D from True into false . 
4. successfully reproduce it 


poc logs 


```
POST /api-umbrella/v1/users.json?api_key=8Mndjk7k8ygsU4rM1lwBltMzet1FEAIuZeaqzEqV HTTP/1.1
Host: api.data.gov
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:55.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/55.0
Accept: application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
Referer: https://api.data.gov/signup/
Content-Length: 564
Cookie: _ga=GA1.3.122453759.1504205343; _ga=GA1.2.122453759.1504205343; _api_umbrella_--beda858f41948ac725e4c3aaae87c38e95d34136; _gid=GA1.3.1781902913.1504726572; _gid=GA1.2.1781902913.1504726572; _gat_GSA_ENOR0=1; _gat=1; _gat_legacy=1
Connection: close

user%5Bfirst_name%5D=hacker&user%5Blast_name%5D=hacker&user%5Bemail%5D=hacker%40gmail.com&user%5Buse_description%5D=&user%5Bterms_and_conditions%5D=1&user%5Bregistration_source%5D=web&options%5Bexample_api_url%5D=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.data.gov%2Fnrel%2Falt-fuel-stations%2Fv1%2Fnearest.json%3Fapi_key%3D%7B%7Bapi_key%7D%7D%26location%3DDenver%2BCO&options%5Bcontact_url%5D=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.data.gov%2Fcontact%2F&options%5Bsite_name%5D=&options%5Bsend_welcome_email%5D=true&options%5Bemail_from_name%5D=&options%5Bemail_from_address%5D=&options%5Bverify_email%5D=false

```


response 

```

{"user":{"id":"9f522604-6ccc-4135-a330-3dd678ae9621","first_name":"hacker","last_name":"hacker","email":"hacker@gmail.com","website":null,"use_description":"","registration_source":"web","throttle_by_ip":null,"roles":null,"enabled":true,"created_at":"2017-09-06T19:57:10Z","updated_at":"2017-09-06T19:57:10Z","api_key":"0dA6hjpXUG0V9Lj7kQkx8yiKkm9Go9H15VyPt8fs","settings":null,"creator":null,"updater":null}}

```

Best Regards
vulnerability_information_html:
Description
Remote attackers are able to retrieve a valid working api key with random Generation Process without a secure parsing or secure channel , human verification ..etc .
the current proccess for requesting any api key is with signup form , and message with api delivered privately to user , developer ..etc
so in this vulnerability any user can send alot of requests for any email with valid leaked api key .

Vulnerable module

[+] api-umbrella/v1/users.json

Vulnerable parameter

[+] options%5Bverify_email%5D

Proof of concept

  1. goes to signup form https://api.data.gov/signup/
  2. intercept the post data
  3. change parameter value s%5Bverify_email%5D from True into false .
  4. successfully reproduce it

poc logs

Best Regards

activities.message:
Hey @lawrenceamer -

Thank you for your submission. We have validated this issue and forwarded the report to the responsible team for this application. They will evaluate and let us know whether or not they will be implementing a fix.

Thanks!
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @lawrenceamer -

Thank you for your submission. We have validated this issue and forwarded the report to the responsible team for this application. They will evaluate and let us know whether or not they will be implementing a fix.

Thanks!

additional_data.old_title: Leak Valid API With out Verification -
additional_data.new_title: [api.data.gov] Leak Valid API With out Verification -

activities.message: api.data.gov is not eligible for bounties, but we are still investigating your report and will update you on the status when we have more information to share. Thanks again for your report!
activities.markdown_message: api.data.gov is not eligible for bounties, but we are still investigating your report and will update you on the status when we have more information to share. Thanks again for your report!

activities.message:
# From the api.data.gov team

Thanks! This is expected and correct behavior. Most agencies don't actually do the e-mail verification for API keys, and instead give API keys to users immediately (for example, you can see this same type of API request made without e-mail verification here: https://api.nasa.gov/index.html#apply-for-an-api-key). But we flag the accounts differently based on whether the api key was returned immediately or sent via e-mail, so then each agency can choose whether they want to allow verified or unverified keys to access their individual APIs.

(It's perhaps not the most obvious setup, but this stems from how we added the concept of verified keys as an opt-in and backwards compatible way)
activities.markdown_message:
From the api.data.gov team

Thanks! This is expected and correct behavior. Most agencies don't actually do the e-mail verification for API keys, and instead give API keys to users immediately (for example, you can see this same type of API request made without e-mail verification here: https://api.nasa.gov/index.html#apply-for-an-api-key). But we flag the accounts differently based on whether the api key was returned immediately or sent via e-mail, so then each agency can choose whether they want to allow verified or unverified keys to access their individual APIs.

(It's perhaps not the most obvious setup, but this stems from how we added the concept of verified keys as an opt-in and backwards compatible way)

activities.message: Hi @coffeecup @jjediny , the api should be disclosed in this way , and for other impact i have discovered another issue in this module allows remote attackers to spoof the sender name , by bypassing smtp verification on host , by changing parameter email_from_name%5D into for example Yahoo Company or anything see the poc below
activities.markdown_message: Hi @coffeecup @jjediny , the api should be disclosed in this way , and for other impact i have discovered another issue in this module allows remote attackers to spoof the sender name , by bypassing smtp verification on host , by changing parameter email_from_name%5D into for example Yahoo Company or anything see the poc below

activities.message: We appreciate the information and will consider this in the future, but are not taking immediate action at this time as a result of this report and not tracking this as a security issue. This asset is out of scope for our bug bounty program. Therefore, we’ll be closing this as Informative. Thanks and we're looking forward to working with you on future reports.
activities.markdown_message: We appreciate the information and will consider this in the future, but are not taking immediate action at this time as a result of this report and not tracking this as a security issue. This asset is out of scope for our bug bounty program. Therefore, we’ll be closing this as Informative. Thanks and we're looking forward to working with you on future reports.
